xxl.core.cursors.visual
Class ControllerJPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  xxl.core.cursors.visual.ControllerJPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class ControllerJPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This class provides a visual component that can be used for the remote control of an arbitrary object. The class depends on a controllable object and provides a visual controller panel for remotely controlling it.

See Also:
IteratorControllable, JPanel, Serialized Form

The controllable object that should be remotely controlled by this visual controller panel.

A visual button calling the go method of the controllable object.

A visual button calling the pause method of the controllable object.

A visual button calling the go(int) method of the controllable object.

A visual button calling the reset method of the controllable object.

close

protected javax.swing.JButton close
A visual button calling the close method of the controllable object.

steps

protected int steps
The number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle, i.e., the parameter passed to the controllable object's go(int) method.

stepsMin

protected int stepsMin
The minimum number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle, i.e., the minimum parameter passed to the controllable object's go(int) method.

The maximum number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle, i.e., the maximum parameter passed to the controllable object's go(int) method.

protected javax.swing.JLabel stepsLabel
A visual label showing a title for the slider that is used to adjust the number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle, i.e., the parameter passed to the controllable object's go(int) method.

protected javax.swing.JSlider stepsSlider
The visual slider that is used to adjust the number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle, i.e., the parameter passed to the controllable object's go(int) method.

Constructor Detail

ControllerJPanel

public ControllerJPanel(Controllable controllable,
                        java.awt.LayoutManager layout,
                        int stepsMin,
                        int stepsMax)
Creates a new visual controller panel controlling the specified controllable object using the given layout manager. The minimum and maximum number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle, i.e., the minimum and maximum parameter passed to the controllable object's go(int) method must also be specified.

Parameters:
controllable - the controllable object to be controlled by the visual controller panel.
layout - the layout manager used to manage the layout of this panel.
stepsMin - the minimum number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle, i.e., the minimum parameter passed to the controllable object's go(int) method.
stepsMax - the maximum number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle, i.e., the maximum parameter passed to the controllable object's go(int) method.

ControllerJPanel

public ControllerJPanel(Controllable controllable)
Creates a new visual controller panel controlling the specified controllable object using the given layout manager. The minimum and maximum number of steps the controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle, i.e., the minimum and maximum parameter passed to the controllable object's go(int) method, is set to 1 resp. 100.

Parameters:
controllable - the controllable object to be controlled by the visual controller panel.
Method Detail

init

protected void init()
Initializes the visual controller panel, i.e, the buttons and the slider contained by it.

resetButtons

protected void resetButtons()
Resets the buttons contained by the visual controller panel to their initial state, which are as follows:
go
enabled
pause
disabled
next
enabled if the supportsGoSteps returns true, otherwise disabled
close
enabled if the supportsClose returns true, otherwise disabled
reset
enabled if the supportsReset returns true, otherwise disabled

go_pressed

protected void go_pressed()
Sets the buttons contained by the visual controller panel after the button go has been pressed and calls the concerning operation of the controllable object. The buttons' state is as follows:
go
disabled
pause
enabled
next
disabled
close
disabled
reset
disabled

pause_pressed

protected void pause_pressed()
Sets the buttons contained by the visual controller panel after the button pause has been pressed and calls the concerning operation of the controllable object. The buttons' state is set by a call to resetButtons.

next_pressed

protected void next_pressed(int n)
Sets the buttons contained by the visual controller panel after the button next has been pressed and calls the concerning operation of the controllable object. The buttons' state is set by a call to resetButtons.

Parameters:
n - the number of steps the underlying controllable object will be allowed to resume its life cycle.

reset_pressed

protected void reset_pressed()
Sets the buttons contained by the visual controller panel after the button reset has been pressed and calls the concerning operation of the controllable object. The buttons' state is set by a call to resetButtons.

close_pressed

protected void close_pressed()
Sets the buttons contained by the visual controller panel after the button close has been pressed and calls the concerning operation of the controllable object. The buttons' state is as follows:
go
disabled
pause
disabled
next
disabled
close
disabled
reset
disabled
